Question: How can I create constrained InputStream to read only part of the file?: :I want to create an InputStream that is limited to a certain range of bytes in file, e.g. to bytes from position 0 to 100. So that the client code should see EOF once 100th byte is reached.
Please using this api: InputStream.read.
Answer: You can achieve this by wrapping your InputStream with a custom class that implements the same interface. Here is an example:

<<<api>>>: InputStream
<<<code>>>: 
```java
public class LimitedInputStream extends InputStream {
    private InputStream in;
    private long limit;
    private long count;

    public LimitedInputStream(InputStream in, long limit) {
        this.in = in;
        this.limit = limit;
    }

    @Override
    public int read() throws IOException {
        if (count >= limit) {
            return -1;
        }
        count++;
        return in.read();
    }
}
```
<<<explanation>>>: This class extends InputStream and overrides the read() method. It keeps track of the number of bytes read so far and returns -1 when the limit is reached. The original InputStream is wrapped in the constructor.

You can use it like this:
```java
try (InputStream in = new FileInputStream("file.txt");
     InputStream limitedIn = new LimitedInputStream(in, 100)) {
    // Read from limitedIn instead of in
}
```
This will limit the read to the first 100 bytes of the file.

Note: This code assumes that the file size is less than or equal to the limit. If the file size is larger than the limit, you may need to handle that case.
